title.narrative: Providing safe drinking water and sanitation facilities for drought affected population and IDPs in

description.narrative:
The USD $ 509197.34 grant will help reduce suffering, risk of illness and death among IDPs from diseases associated with of lack of clean and safe water and proper health services and poor sanitation. The current security situation in Badghis province is comparatively better and conducive. The project will be implemented without facing any serious issue of access and security. AHDAA has a strong presence in Badghis province especially in the targeted villages. It has implemented various programs in the area and has good access to all the villages including IDP families. To ensure results, the assistance will include a significant level of community mobilization, involving health promotion and communication.
CA’s is committed to empowerment of disadvantaged in humanitarian interventions. Priorities given to communities closest to disaster and the most vulnerable. CA will design the implementation and reporting plan by putting in significant human resources.

This project is funded by CHF (UNOCHA). Activity details are given in project proposal, uploaded in ‘Reporting- Documentation Section’. Proposed intervention will support IDPs and host community in 14 targeted villages of Muqur and Bala-Murghab districts to address identified WASH gaps by: 1) Improve access to safe water, meet minimum Sphere standards of 15 litres per person per day 2) Improve sanitation facilities 3) Provide hygiene kits 4) Enhance hygiene knowledge and behavioural practices, to improve the public and individual health of the 5060 IDP & host communities families. 5) Addressing protection issues.
Important activities : - • Installation of emergency boreholes and hand pumps among affected populations and host communities. • Provision of household water treatment and safe storage solutions • Water trucking for immediate relief: both at points of origin and destination. • Knowledge, Attitude and Practice Assessment in all targeted villages: • Hygiene promotion sessions and distribution of hygiene kits • Provision of emergency latrines and bathing spaces • Ensure supply of water Kits, hygiene Kits, latrine Kits and water treatment chemicals. • Post-Distribution Monitoring (PDM) and reporting.
